page.title: 07WOODLAND NORTH OF HUNTLY
page.content: The Hill of Greenfold was planted in a ten year span 1930-40.There has been some restocking (the replacement of older crops that have been felled) in 1974-5 and will be and will be continuing in 1985 for several years.The Bin section,which is already growing it's second crop and this was planted in 1927-35.Further replantings took place in 1940-46 and a large restocking programme (planting third generation) began in 1980 and will be completed in the early 1990's.The wood harvisted in this area is used for,in its various stages. Early thinning (small roundwood)-wood pulp. Subsequent thinning (small saw logs) -pallet wood. Clear fellings (large saw logs) -building timbers.
